physdesc.extent: 34 linear ft (ca. 36,160 items in 70 boxes, 150 volumes, 1 folder, & 1 scrapbook.

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, speeches, manuscripts, documents, photographs, printed material and audiovisual material of Spruille Braden, 1894-1978, American diplomat and mining engineer.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American diplomat, mining engineer. Braden (1894-1978) was a diplomat in numerous Latin American countries and was particularly well known for his role as the American Representative to the Chaco Peace Conference, 1935-1939, and for his opposition to the Peron regime in Argentina in the 1940s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches, manuscripts, documents, photographs, printed material, and audio visual material, primarily relating to Braden's career as a diplomat. Also included are files from his tenure as Assistant Secretary of State for Latin American Affairs, 1945-1947. The numerous scrapbooks in the collection contain clippings, photographs, and invitations. Major correspondents include Adolf A. Berle, Jr., Homer S. Cummings, James A. Farley, Barry Goldwater, Ernest Hemingway, John Edgar Hoover, Cordell Hull, Frances Kellor, Edward I. Koch, Archibald MacLeish, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Leo S. Rowe, Edward R. Stettinius, Jr., Thomas J. Watson, and Sumner Welles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Selected materials cataloged; remainder arranged. This collection is arranged in three series:
Series I: Correspondence and Catalogued Items
Series II: Appearances
Series III: Manuscripts, Documents and Miscellaneous

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.corpname: United States.--Assistant Secretary of State for Latin American Affairs.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: Boxes 4-72. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

custodhist.p: Gift of Spruille Braden, 1958; gift of the Braden family, 1978; gift of William Braden, 1981.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Spruille Braden Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

did.unittitle: Series I: Correspondence and Catalogued Items

scopecontent.p: This series contains catalouged correspondence, manuscripts and photographs. This series also contains general and diplomatic corrospondence arranged chronologically and alphabetically.

did.unittitle: (1929-1933) - Letters to and from his father

scopecontent.p: This series contains documents relating to speeches and conference attendence by Braden. This series is arranged alphabetically and chronologically.

Series III: Manuscripts, Documents and Miscellaneous

scopecontent.p: This series contains financial and legal documents, manuscripts, scrapbooks, pamphlets, phonograph records, movie film and books from the library of Spruille Braden. Braden library items in this series include approximately 150 volumes inscribed to or by Braden; annotated by, citing, or by Braden; and miscellaneous works. Most concern South America, diplomacy, or ultraconservative politics.
